meanings.definition: A territory or domain under the control of a lord or noble.
meanings.sent1: The signiories of the king included vast lands and castles.
meanings.sent2: The signiories of the baron were scattered across the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The signiories of the duke were so extensive that he needed a map to keep track.
meanings.sent4: Her influence over the court was like a signiories, shaping decisions and alliances.
meanings.sent5: The signiories of the noble were marked by grandeur and wealth.

meanings.definition: The rank or position of a lord or noble.
meanings.sent1: In the hierarchy, his signiories granted him respect and authority.
meanings.sent2: The signiories of the earl were evident in his elegant mannerisms.
meanings.sent3: His signiories at the banquet table were undeniable as he sat at the head.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the signiories of a queen, commanding attention wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The signiories of the lord were evident in the way he held himself with pride.

meanings.definition: The power or authority of a lord or noble.
meanings.sent1: His signiories allowed him to make decisions that affected the entire region.
meanings.sent2: The signiories of the count were unquestioned by the villagers.
meanings.sent3: With great signiories comes great responsibility, he often reminded himself.
meanings.sent4: The signiories of the duchess were like a shield, protecting her from criticism.
meanings.sent5: The signiories of the nobleman were evident in the way others deferred to his judgment.
